website_summaries.verdict: Foam spray that is effective on wasps and keeps wasps away after spraying.
pros: Foam sprays up to 20 feet and kills wasps immediately
Also kills wasps that come back to the nest after spraying
Easy to spray small areas accurately
cons: Doesn't reach the full 20 feet if there is any breeze

customer_reviews.title: SELF DEFENSE
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my roommate. She won’t keep a knife or gun for self defense and we live in a rough part of town. When I’m not home she’s literally defenseless. I read somewhere that you can use this about as effectively as mace but it looks innocent enough. Well guess what, we got broke into and IT WORKS. She nailed the guy in the face and he crumbled to the ground and I handled it from there til the cops got there. The guy didn’t think to try to take it from her because who thinks bee spray is a weapon????
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing stuff
customer_reviews.text: Had a huge nest in a wood pile stored in a trash can. Managed to get the top off and kick the can over. Sprayed into the wood pile and all hell let loose. The next day there was not a wasp there.
customer_reviews.author: Alan F

customer_reviews.title: RED FLAG DANGEROUS SITUATION HERE
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 2 bottles of this wasp killer as I'd ordered before and no issue. It's a good product btw. HOWEVER, these 2 cans were not wrapped AT ALL, just rolling around in a MUCH LARGER cardboard box. Upon opening, 1 bottle had been smashed to bits; lid destroyed, & potentially could have sprayed me in the face. Order at your own risk. It's obviously not Ortho; the local fools who package HAZARDOUS CHEMICALS without wits. I worked in the chem & plastics biz for many years including insecticides ... OY VEY!
customer_reviews.author: pam

customer_reviews.title: Seems completely ineffective for Yellowjackets
customer_reviews.text: I have an underground yellowjacket hive next to my house. I bought four cans. Even evening I spray a football-ssized pile of foam over the entrance. Every morning I repeat. Each application uses 1/3 of a can. I repeat this for 6 nights, and 6 mornings, using up the 4 cans I bought. There appears to be no difference in hive activity. Not useful for underground hives - Yellowjackets.
customer_reviews.author: P. Grace

customer_reviews.title: Helped me to solve wasp problem
customer_reviews.text: Wasp nest was destroyed with one application of this spray. Spray bottle works perfectly, solution is indeed deadly for wasps and spray jet is going the desired direction without even a drop of poison left on a bottle or on arms. I did not try to "shoot" from afar. Instead, I sprayed entrance to the nest on a near-rainy sunrise from the distance of about 3 ft. and walked away after 20 seconds. Wasps were not active initially, but when they became active and tried to leave the nest I already was too far and they were dying barely making it out. Then I revisited nest in the evening to clean it all up - it was perfectly safe.
customer_reviews.author: Lenny Sh

customer_reviews.title: Loads of foam
customer_reviews.text: The absolute best. I have dealt heavily with red paper wasps in Mississippi, this product is the best. Yes it is a few bucks more expensive than what is available at Walmart and hardware stores, but it is worth it. I have tried every brand available to me, and this can by far produces the most foam. My shaving cream doesn't even produce this much. It isnt a water foam either, this is a thick several minute last foam. I already bought more.
customer_reviews.author: ClaytonTop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work on yellow jackets as claimed on can
customer_reviews.text: It sprays well and covered the nest and two yellow jackets with a big batch of foam. When I went to inspect two hours later the two wasps were wriggling on the ground. Maybe they were suffering. I don't know. It looked like at least one was starting to recover completely, though. I guess this stuff just doesn't work on yellow jackets, even though it claims to work on yellow jackets on the can. Every other wasp spray I've tried has worked instantly.
customer_reviews.author: Lund Wolfe

customer_reviews.title: The best wasp killer I have ever bought!
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best wasp killer you'll ever buy! It really does foam up, sprays a really far distance; so you dont have to be on the nest to kill it and it kills on contact! It traps the wasps in the foam and kills the returning ones! Any place I have ever sprayed, no future nests have been made there. My husband and son are highly allergic so having a good insect killer is very important to me! I will from now on keep this wasp killer on hand and have multiple cans at arms reach all over the property!
customer_reviews.author: All American Girl

customer_reviews.title: Does not phase Yellow Jackets
customer_reviews.text: Very active Yellow Jacket nest in ground. Got this cause it stated creates foam which I figured would prevent the Yellow Jackets from attacking while I sprayed. As advertised, the foam was great, large mound of foam over main hole the their alternate hole. No problem being attacked. Used one whole can to cover both holes. Came back an hour later. Foam had dissolved but light activity coming and going from main hole. Used second can to again cover both holes. Checked next day and Yellow Jacket activity was as if I had never sprayed. Don' get if your after the YJ's.
customer_reviews.author: Dale E Barber

customer_reviews.title: Major price hike
customer_reviews.text: these were previously reasonably priced at their average price, 3.99. Now it has jumped in cost 11.70. This is ridiculous - one of the biggest drawbacks of amazon is that sometimes their prices function as if it is the damn NASDAQ It's not worth it at this cost because one bottle doesn't last that long if you actually have wasps around your house. There is not even that much product in a bottle to last 2 days if Wasps come into your house, garage or outdoor spaces regularly - so the price hike is absolutely ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: Bon

customer_reviews.title: Good for direct nest hits only.
customer_reviews.text: The foam barrier did not instantly kill some yellow jackets. It will start to immobilize them. Best for outside nests and ones in ground. Mine was behind vinyl siding and a couple feet down from entrance behind insulation in crawl space. A brave friend pulled back insulation and sprayed nest at close range continuously and drenching it. The spray alone didn’t work on the Queen. She was huge! Had to manually dispatch her. But now the nest is gone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Clogs constantly, did not spray anything, useless product, waste of money, very sad
customer_reviews.text: The product is totally useless did not kill anything. It is extremely difficult to use because the nozzle is constantly clogging. Did not spray. We are extremely unhappy. "The Almighty" Amazon.com will not take the product back, give us another can or refund our money. Maybe we got a bad can. We wish we could get another can to try or get our money back. bad product. Do not waste your money. Go to your local hardware store. If it did not work, you can at least get another can or get your money back.
customer_reviews.author: Turtle Princess

customer_reviews.title: Arrived Shattered and Useless - Do Not Buy!
customer_reviews.text: Thrown into a box that clearly did not fit well in with zero padding. The cap/sprayer arrived shattered with pesticides coating the inside of the box. I'm glad I got to it before one of the neighborhood cats did!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes killed, sometimes didn't
customer_reviews.text: My wasp problem is weird. The nest is nowhere to be found, but they love the sunny side of my house. Usually every year, around August, I'll spray 10 or 20 of them which curbs the issue for a few weeks, at least until winter hits. But this can would sometimes kill a wasp after much, much deserved torment (not anywhere near instantly), or the wasp would sit around for a while, brush off his wings, then fly away. Maybe it died later, but my yard was still rather filled with them this year so I'm not very convinced
customer_reviews.author: Mario

customer_reviews.title: Buy this ! It’s worth it hands down !
customer_reviews.text: This is the spray to use if you have a hornets nest! It Encapsulates the nest with a thick foam Immediately which prevents any hornets from escaping and coming after you! They die inside the nest while it smothers them ! Great product would buy again if I ever had any type of wasp, bee, hornets nest! No smell ! shoots at least 20!feet !
customer_reviews.author: John C.

customer_reviews.title: Beware...
customer_reviews.text: For a nest about the size of a soccer ball, you need minimum 2 to 3 of this because it runs out very quickly, which can be quite dangerous if you don't have enough to kill most of the wasps. Worse, the foam does not stick to the nest as I would have expected. The foam quickly fall down and vanishes. Very disappointed. Luckily I bought a beekeeping suit for extra precaution.
customer_reviews.author: Rol

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! The foam shoots far so you don’t have to get too close. We had some hornets take over our playset, we sprayed and left it over night and in the morning nothing flying around and a pile of dead bugs on the playset.
customer_reviews.author: Amie Garner

customer_reviews.title: Defective and Ortho would not replace
customer_reviews.text: The wasp spray was defective, would not go beyond 6 feet, not anywhere near the 20 feet as advertised. The spray was wide and disbursed; nothing like other wasp sprays I have used in the last 40 years of my life (I’m 77). I just wanted to send this back and get a replacement, but Ortho will not allow that. I tried to contact them, as this was my only option and I receive no response.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia P.

customer_reviews.title: Kills on Contact
customer_reviews.text: Works just as I needed. But dang... I wonder how toxic it is so that when the wind happened to blow it back at me the one time I went to spray it (and it wasn't a windy day)... probably knocked a few years off my life. D'oh!! Yes, the moment it hit their nest, they dropped... a few flew for a few feet, then dropped... none made it to me about 12 feet away... but I did back up too after initially hitting them.
customer_reviews.author: ID-27529Top Contributor: Star Wars

customer_reviews.title: Bee spray
customer_reviews.text: I used this entire can one night, still had bees the next day. Used another brand the second night, still had bees. Used a third can the third night and still have bees. Less each day but after the third night, I gave up. Each spraying I emptied the entire can directly into the entrance of the bees each night. I know for sure as I watched them during the day and at dusk while they were returning to the nest. The fourth and fifth nights, I flooded the ground with water. After that only a few remained that would return to the nest each night as I watched.
customer_reviews.author: Connie

customer_reviews.title: Foaming is a Good Thing
customer_reviews.text: This shoots a stream of insecticide about as far as any "Flying wasp" poison. I noticed that anything hit went down quickly. What sets this apart from some others I've used is that it foams up on hitting something. I'm not sure how much it expands, but I did notice the foam expanding into a hole a bit and temporarily blocking off nest entrance/exit. I doubt you can use it long holding the can vertical, but I needed to spray up under a low overhanging board. It worked well for that for a few 3 to 5 second bursts from vertical, which was great news for this case. It definitely worked for me.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey A. Hawkins

customer_reviews.title: Instant result
customer_reviews.text: This product is fantastic ... it kills wasps instantly. However, if the nest is in a place difficult to reach, you may need to spray many times. Ours was behind the house siding - actually we couldn't see it ... we used 4 sprays, spraying the point of entrance, till we didn't see any activity anymore and it worked. Also it is true that wasps trying to return to the nest get caught in the foam and the moment they touch the foam, die ...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Can not full
customer_reviews.text: In a 16 ounce container I got 4 squirts and it was empty?! The foam didn’t project more than 10 feet and was so full of air that it went everywhere. I had to get up really close to get anything on the nest. My guess is there’s only 4-6 ounces of product in the 16 ounce can.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One and done
customer_reviews.text: Hornets were making a home under the eve of our garage - panic ensues. Waited until dusk, gave it a could spray, and Ta Da! No more. The foam covers everything and I wasn't even concerned about being stung. Those little beasts couldn't get out from under the foam before I high-tailed it back in the house. The next morning it was a cemetery of those buggers and a quick tap on the nest brought the whole experience to an end.
customer_reviews.author: D. Cowger

customer_reviews.title: Bye bye bees
customer_reviews.text: The power of the foam was remarkable. After less than a minute, majority of the foam fell. Bees are dead. There is still foam over the bees nest but hopefully the nest will fall soon too.
customer_reviews.author: Krystal Lynette

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff...dissolves the beasties
customer_reviews.text: I have tried budget brands, that are more sprays. Some of these have their uses, especially when the wasp is flying fast. This is my most used, (I use both). This is more of a foam, it lasts LONG time, and is especially effective when I used it on nests (on the walls, etc). It is like a all encompassing foam, and the foam stays their for many minutes. I use this on other flying insects as well, like big beetles, and does work on palmetto bugs. I always have at least two in the house. For the price, it is great, it works, and that is what I need.
customer_reviews.author: Canopus

customer_reviews.title: If silly string and toxic meringue had a baby...
customer_reviews.text: It's messy but effective. Found 5 nests in our back yard, and tried every "humane" method to get rid of them, to no avail. So, waited until most of the insects were away for the day, and sprayed the empty nests. For a couple of nests this worked, but the others saw the homeowners return a day or two later and required a respray later. Product did the job, with minimal cruelty. Insects abandoned their nests and I was able to knock them down. Dramatic reduction in presence, and I hope they found a happy new home...elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: NW

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work on yellow jacket
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use it on yellow jacket. I used it as instructed. The next day I went to see what happened to the yellow jacket nest, I found few dead arround the nest and thought that I am done and no more yellow jacket, but after moving one of the stones on the top of the nest, a few yellow jacket attacked me and ended up with 5 sting :( This product didn't kill all the yellow jacket, it barely killed few.
customer_reviews.author: G.M

customer_reviews.title: Devil's soldiers no match for this spray
customer_reviews.text: I had the beginnings of portals to the underworld known as wasp nests. I pressure washed the nests with water, but alas they returned to rebuild. I ordered this spray and unleashed my fury sometime in the early evening when they were getting ready to settle down from their day of war mongering. I sprayed each nest with this foam and trapped them in a white foamy case of their own fear they exert on innocents. They dropped to their demise and the war was won. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: jason diaz

customer_reviews.title: Weak forumla
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this based on the positive reviews. However, when I used it to kill a yellow-jacket nest, I had to apply it numerous times to kill the insects. Even those who fell in the foam puddle under the nest took minutes to die. Thankfully, I had an old can of Enforcer Wasp and Yellow Jacket Foam that worked better. I don't recommend this product. You want something that kills the yellow jackets instantly. This product isn't it.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte K. Lowrie

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't spray even 15 feet in the air
customer_reviews.text: If you are aiming downward, it shoots a stream. As soon as you angle the can to shoot higher than you're holding it, it turns into a complete aerosol spray that goes no where. Very disappointed with this. I might return it, but not sure it's worth it. $12 is pretty pricey for bug killer. I'd really just like a refund without having to go through the hassle of the return. I'm sure it'd kill the bowling ball sized wasp nest under my gutters if it reached it because the Ortho home defense I use on the perimeter of my house kills everything that touches it. Maybe it's just this can that has a terrible nozzle, I dunno.
customer_reviews.author: gtothew

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to get rid of paper wasps living in my retaining wall. At dusk I sprayed a half of the can to the hole but the form disappeared in a few seconds. I sprayed the rest in and around the hole the next day. Wasps are still there and seems more active now. The can runs out very quickly, too. It was a total waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: appletree

customer_reviews.title: Holy Cow does it work!
customer_reviews.text: Disclaimer: This is the first wasp killer I've ever used but I'm just amazed that it actually works and HOW FAST AND EFFECTIVE it actually is! I just sprayed this onto a wasp's nest outside of the patio door (which was hidden behind an exterior light) so I hadn't noticed it until it had gotten HUGE. I completely covered the nest with the spray and came back 2 hours later and the nest had pretty much COMPLETELY decomposed and pieces of it were all over the ground but basically all evidence of the wasps were history! I'm shocked how easy and fast this was! It was almost fun!
customer_reviews.author: online-shopping-addict

customer_reviews.title: wasps gone, i guess it worked?
customer_reviews.text: 1) The range is very limited, standing on ground floor trying to hit the first floor balcony, it cannot reach. 2) Content is very limited, i was expecting the can to last a while, but after just 5-7 spreads, the can is completely empty! you definitely need to buy multiple cans just in case. 3) A swarm of wasp showed up on my balcony for the past 2 weeks, i am pretty sure they made a nest inside the balcony wood but cant visually confirm. I spread the can all over the balcony wood, did not find a single dead wasp, yet by next day all wasp gone and never returned. So i guess it works
customer_reviews.author: gaga

customer_reviews.title: Great wasp nuker!
customer_reviews.text: Works great. A bit rough getting bthe stream spray started as it spits everywhere until a stream forms. But press hard and it streams faster. Wasps won't even fly after being touched by these during the day. Though i still do not recommend doing so on a batch of wasps. My case was a mere 1-2 wasps as they are only starting to build hives. Was able to spray them from the ground as they built hives under our roof overhang.
customer_reviews.author: Robbie

customer_reviews.title: Not Effective on Hidden Nest
customer_reviews.text: I had a yellow jacket nest within a window dormer. The wasps were entering holes in rotted wood to reach the nest. Following the instructions I applied the foam over and around the holes in the wood after sundown. The next day the nest had the same wasp activity. I tried again during the day while the wasps were active. The wasps were buzzing around the foam but they avoided it. I believe you have to spray the wasps or the actual nest directly. In this case the nest is hidden within the dormer. I had to call an exterminator who applied a dust. This ultimately worked.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Urteaga

customer_reviews.title: Range of spray is too short to be effective.
customer_reviews.text: Insufficient range of spray, 1 to 1.5 feet. Product indicates foam from sprayer is to prevent wasps & hornets from flying, while this may be true, given the very short range of the sprayer, the hornets & wasps will have already left their nests & attacked long before you get in sprayer range! Will seek permission to return. UPDATE - Non-returnable to Amazon! Buyer beware & buy local!
customer_reviews.author: Mo Grunt

customer_reviews.title: Streams poison everywhere, takes at least 30 min to kill
customer_reviews.text: The streaming is good so you don't have to get close, but the bad part is the stream rains poison droplets everywhere, not just the direction you point it in. I used this inside for a mud dauber, then a wasp. Both experiences were identical. The poison sprayed over everything around me. It took three or four stream sprays directly on the insect to slow it down. Neither of them died. I waited 30 minutes on both, then had to finish them off with my shoe. Then, I got to clean up the droplets practically everywhere. I'll try another brand next time. I don't recommend this at all.
customer_reviews.author: beth

customer_reviews.title: It's foam not a spray
customer_reviews.text: The add on price was attractive but the delivery system is a foam which clung to the outside porch rafters and then dripped, I thought I was buying a mist spray. It might be a good idea if you could get up close and personal to a place where the wasps have crawled into to spray the foam block it. I decided to go with the wasp hanging trap and let a neighbor have this item.
customer_reviews.author: Mountain Girl

customer_reviews.title: Works really well, over a long distance
customer_reviews.text: Recently discovered a yellow jacket nest above my back door about 10 feet up. This arrived quickly, and instantly foamed on contact, going the distance with ease. Just make sure the wind isn't blowing in your direction. This did a great job of knocking the wasps off the nest, and even killed the ones that flew back after the first shot. The nest was then easily taken down within a few minutes after ensuring more wasps weren't returning. Overall, really happy with this wasp killer, and have plenty left over to take down another nest as needed.
customer_reviews.author: Samrio

customer_reviews.title: BYE BYE WASPS!
customer_reviews.text: I have a tile roof that Wasps think is there personal place to build nests! I am HIGHLY ALLERGIC TO THEM. If they weren't so mean spirited I would leave them alone, but they have chased me into the house several times! I like this because it shoots far enough way that I won't get stung. I also take this when we go hiking, and camping great against skunks, raccoons. (my dogs think they are play things, ha ha) plus you can shoot far enough away so they don't get hurt. Haven't tried it on a bear yet, thank God ;)
customer_reviews.author: lola

customer_reviews.title: this is a FOAM spray, so prepare to get hit while using it
customer_reviews.text: ok, so logically we purchase this type of product to spray ABOVE our heads at wasp nests in a lot of cases. This is a FOAM spray so when using it, be prepared to get out of the way or you'll end up wearing it. In addition, the weight of the foam means the spray is going to drip down the siding as well or to the ground below. I don't understand why there is a product on the market that sprays heavy foam when the normal usage is to spray it on the underside of something above your head.
customer_reviews.author: Seance

customer_reviews.title: One shot problem solver
customer_reviews.text: I bought 4 cans thinking I would need to use at least one per wasps nest and am happy to say I was wrong. The expanding foam completely enveloped a good sized nest and there were no survivors. Note though that some flew as they were falling but none made it past 10 ft. I’d have no hesitation in recommending this to anyone with a wasp nest in their high eaves. The nest I had was in a 20ft. Peaked eave.
customer_reviews.author: whyNOTme

customer_reviews.title: Stained my outdoor siding...spray down with hose immediately!
customer_reviews.text: Have never had this happen with other hornet killers. This one I was using to spray up high at nests, so a good amount of collateral spray was left on my siding. I looked later in the day, and instead of just disappearing, it dyed my siding. Got the hose out and tried hosing it down, but it was TOO LATE. I tested with soap and water on lower areas and I was able to get that off, but I would need to get on a ladder and scrub it everywhere or probably get it power washed to hopefully remove it. Was effective at killing hornets at least.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan I.

customer_reviews.title: BROKEN AND IMPOSSIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE
customer_reviews.text: Bad company and bad product — It came broken in pieces and obviously non-functional for the purpose of spraying from a distance and the company is IMPOSSIBLE TO WORK WITH! They offered me a “$4 off coupon” and Amazon does not give an option to return or refund either. I spent over 30 minutes online with a representative trying to be patient and get help or some type of replacement even just for the plastic top. You better just hope and pray yours comes in fine and how it is supposed to be because you will have no choice but to buy another one and spend your own money if it doesn’t work.
customer_reviews.author: Nicolle

customer_reviews.title: Dont Buy !!
customer_reviews.text: I used about 5/6 of the can and had excellant coverage of an active ground infestation and the next morning, they were all swarming around the same spot that was absolutely covered with this failure of a substance. Considering others have had sucess and I had complete failure, Buy at your own risk because they wont let you return this product or refund your money!!!!! I suggest you dont buy a product that they wont replace with a better product or refund. It shows they dont care.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Foamy Goodness of Death
customer_reviews.text: When we were thinking of purchasing this, we read reviews and one of them said that it would make you feel like a god killing hornets and wasps and let me tell you, that review did not lie. I've become quite the good shot shooting this white foamy goodness at the larger than life hornets here in the South while they fly by me. I always take it outside with me. I think the hornets and learning not to come around to our house anymore, because their numbers in our yard have dwindled! We definitely will be purchasing this in the future!
customer_reviews.author: Dallin & Heather

customer_reviews.title: Did not work in-wall yellow jacket nest
customer_reviews.text: I have a yellow jacket nest between an exterior wall and an overhang. I spray the foam in all the cracks/entrance holes and the returning yellow jackets hover around for a while and fly off. After a couple of minutes, the foam falls off the wall under gravity and then the yellow jackets are free to return. They do not seem put off by the small amount of residue the now-gone foam has left behind. I have used a full can of this with no success. I am trying some powder instead.
customer_reviews.author: HibsMax

customer_reviews.title: Did what we needed it to do
customer_reviews.text: It definitely killed the paper wasps that were nesting on our balcony overhang, but it definitely wasn’t an instant-kill. The poor wasps fell to the ground but it took anywhere between 10 seconds to several minutes for some of them to die. When we noticed, we re-sprayed them and they died faster after reapplication. But anyway, it did the job, went where we needed it to go (shot several feet diagonally), we didn’t get stung, and the wasps are gone.
customer_reviews.author: minamesephy

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic! Saved so much money.
customer_reviews.text: I had a small yellow jacket nest right by my front door, and when they started chasing me and my dog, I knew it was time to take care of it. (I truly hate harming any living things, but when my pups safety is at risk its an easy decision) This stuff sprays on thick and really does its job. I almost paid a professional 15x the cost of this spray and so glad I saved the money! (But for a big issue its probably best to call the pros!). Money very well spent, I'm super pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Dirk Boschek

customer_reviews.title: Didn't Kill the Wasps!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thinking it would stream spray like others I had purchased in the past. First use, it got everwhere, and did not dry up. It also Did not kill the wasps. It did make them fall (I'm assuming because of the weight of the foam on their wings), but the shook it off and became more aggressive. I had to physically stomp out each one. And worse, they are still returning. Also, some of the spray got on my plants, and killed my lavender. I'm extremely disappointed, and I won't buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: Second Purchase
customer_reviews.text: It's good stuff; that's why I bought it again. Had a bee infestation, and worked with a beekeeper to safely and humanely relocate the nest and queen, but there were still several thousand stragglers. One can of this diminished their numbers significantly overnight. One more can ought to do it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely destroyed nests, completely safe.
customer_reviews.text: This is like a cross between shaving gel and the Proton Pack from Ghostbusters. We had three big wasps nests in an undeveloped lot next to ours, and one new one in our backyard. This took care of all of them in under 10 minutes, and half of that was us marveling at how cool it was. If you're nervous about getting stung, don't be. You wait until night, aim the can and spray a long stream at the nest. It is engulfed in a cotton-candy sized ball of foam that doesn't let the wasps escape. 10 minutes later, everything is dead.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Bremmer

customer_reviews.title: 2 cans and no more underground hornets
customer_reviews.text: I had a huge hornet/wasp/killer bee nest underground and I could only see a little of but a bunch of bees were always flying around the hole. I move a little of the dirt so around 5” of the top surface of the nest was showing. I waited until it was dark and used a whole can spraying the small surface that I could see. A couple days later when I check on it, I could see dead bees on the outside but there were still some flying around. I used a 2nd can and drenched it and I no longer have any bees so 2 cans were all that I needed to do the job
customer_reviews.author: MegM2911

customer_reviews.title: #1 Ortho Wasp Spray
customer_reviews.text: This is incredible as many other reviewers have said. Incredibly easy to use, but shake well 1st. Great White Foam Spray that grabs the nest and any wasps in or on the nest. I Highly Recommend This Ortho Wasp Spray and will buy again. Fyi, after checking the Nest the next morning I found All Mosquitos dead, the Nest still full of white foam and No mosquitoes in my backyard. This is the best mosquito spray I've ever found and used in 20 years.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Ruben

customer_reviews.title: Review from a pro
customer_reviews.text: I am a professional Pest Controller with over 30 years experience. I bought this product when MGK stopped making PestXpert. This does everything that did AND it is labeled for wasp control. Same active ingredients. Product does a great job on hornet nests, has a nice, long & narrow stream so it is controllable and predictable. Only drawback is that it is designed with an enclosed trigger making it hard to use with an extension pole device. They would be better off to make a standard exposed trigger without the cap shouldering.
customer_reviews.author: Frequent Amazoner

customer_reviews.title: 50% chance you'll get broken one.
customer_reviews.text: One has top sprayer one did not so one has to be used before other can be used if even possible. So 50% chance your sent a dud. 50% failure rate.
customer_reviews.author: gerit

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT WORK!! DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.text: DOES NOT WORK!!! Just sprayed half a dozen or so wasps coming out of the ground near my driveway. Covers them in foam for a couple minutes and then they crawl out and fly away!! Every other spray I’ve used kills them in 30 seconds or less. Seeing if I can return. Ridiculous
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Foaming goodness!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product. It been a few years since I have use a product like this. I had a hard time finding it locally so I ordered it online; super happy for this. This product shoots a nice consistent stream that instantly turns to foam on the surface. I honestly only needed to spray one time for 2 seconds to completely cover the front of the hive. I will definitely be buying this again. Great product to just have on-hand when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Hels

customer_reviews.title: Worked for years
customer_reviews.text: It's cheap, fast, easy to use, and highly effective. I had no problem reaching wasps trying to nest in the upper corner of the second level, and the lingering foam kept them away without leaving any visible residue on the house. Last year I had to use it in a couple of the bushes out front and same thing - it was highly effective but did not harm the plants. It's worked for me for years and it's what I'll keep using.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Fairly effective foam-type insecticide
customer_reviews.text: When buying this sort of insect killer, the most important thing to check is really the strength -- how much percent of what is in it. The ingredients actually don't vary that much -- they're just the most effective, cheapest chemicals that won't get the manufacturers sued for anything. This is good enough that, sprayed onto yellowjackets or Black Widows to encase them in foam, they will be dead in a few minutes. Not sure how long the residue lasts, but the bugs haven't returned to those exact spots ever again.
customer_reviews.author: Teh Arbitrageur

customer_reviews.title: I don’t think this works.
customer_reviews.text: The wasps like to roll around in the foam, shake it off and fly away on important wasp business. Am I doing something wrong?
customer_reviews.author: lolla tenko

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I sprayed down a bunch of hornet nests with this. The great thing about it is that you can spray this from far away. I literally felt like Spider-Man when I eliminated all the hornet nests around the house. Unfortunately, I do feel the product does kind of stop the insects from going back but only for like a week or two. What’s best is if you hose the area down to ensure that you eliminated their nest.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph L.

customer_reviews.title: kills great, runs out too fast
customer_reviews.text: Perfect, hit them with the foam..they die right away ...but you can hit maybe 4-5 in 1 can..foam runs out quick, especially when you spray the nest and the shrubs/tress they go to. I went through 2 cans in less than half a day. 😐😑🤨
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for ground hornets
customer_reviews.text: I had a nest of ground hornets under a rock with a small hole they were using for entry / exit. I got stung three times when I discovered it, so I purchased this spray. I visited the nest and doused it with foam...seemed to do the job. The next week, I was mowing near the nest again and got stung from a hornet using the same nest. This time, I REALLY sprayed the nest. Now, a couple weeks later, the opening is huge and the nest is quite active. Seems like the spray was just an annoyance to them. I'm going to try something else.
customer_reviews.author: LiviPa

customer_reviews.title: Foam Does NOT Stay on Nest!!
customer_reviews.text: I used this wasp killer in a wood barn. I sprayed it on a nest on the top wooden frame of a window. There is a plastic sheet on the inside of the window and the foam just slid down the sheet without killing the wasps! I sprayed it right on the nest which is on the wood and it still slid down. The wasps are still alive and well the next day. I tried again with no luck. What a waste of money!!!
customer_reviews.author: Susan  Douglas

customer_reviews.title: Effective wasp killer
customer_reviews.text: I have a farm with 5 barns and out buildings. I constantly am battling wasp nests. This spray was effective at about 10 ft, spraying a foam onto the nests. Most of the wasps immediately fall to the ground. Interesting though I did a single wasp that was coated with foam drop to the ground and keep walking around even after being resprayed several times. Hmmmm.. Could this be the beginning of a resistant strain? I got about 6-8 nests at 10 ft but then had to get closer as the can began to empty. A good buy
customer_reviews.author: JIM THEILEN

customer_reviews.title: Effective!
customer_reviews.text: Had no problem with the packaging or the can itself. We had the beginnings of a wasp nest forming on the back of the house. Followed the directions, sprayed the foam directly on the nest, and it just stuck! After a bit, the foam did dissolve revealing dead wasps. But now we can knock down the dormant nest. We also did a test spray to see if it will really spray as far as it claims. It does! Happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Great product, Kills well, doesn’t smell or stain
customer_reviews.text: I moved into a new place and had an entire shed overtaken by wasps. Used a couple of cans of this stuff and they have not been back. I’ve seen well over a hundred dead bodies. Just like all of these kinds of things, the can doesn’t last super long but the stuff sprays a solid 15’-20’ away and kills everything it touches almost instantly. Soaked a nest the size of a tennis ball and they just kept falling out dead. Good stuff, life saver! Doesn’t smell or stain anything!
customer_reviews.author: Grayson Newland

customer_reviews.title: Kills on contact. But doesn't sterilize the area. Those that return continue
customer_reviews.text: It is more convenient than a fly swatter. Considering it is a pesticide, probably many would choose a fly swatter instead. I sprayed it for few days on a crack where some yellow jackets hover. It killed those that came in contact. Some had foam on their thorax and kept flying. Don't know if it they died later. Few hours later, the ones which were away came back and continued with their business like nothing happened. Even repetitive treatment didn't eliminate the bugs. I would love a refund.
customer_reviews.author: S. Hosur

customer_reviews.title: Got Wasps? Ready... Aim...Fire! No more Wasps!
customer_reviews.text: Got Wasps? Not to worry with Ortho® Home Defense Wasp/pest spray. It'll shoot a foamy stream of pesticide approx 20ft and stops those wasps, bees, hornets, ON CONTACT! It kills larvae in their nests too! Be sure to pay attention to wind direction, as it BURNS if it gets in your skin or in your eyes. NEVER spray into the wind! It works great! I keep 4 cans around all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Paula Jean

customer_reviews.title: Just okay...
customer_reviews.text: Not the greatest for its maximum distance; especially overhead. It is great within 6-8 feet; however, not as effective beyond 10 feet away. Practically useless overhead; even with NO WIND. It spreads out and foams prior to contacting the target.
customer_reviews.author: Michael L. Williams

customer_reviews.title: No More Wasps
customer_reviews.text: I am so afraid of wasps and this stuff makes it easy to stand back and kill them. In Texas during the summer you see so many of them but it is so scary to kill them. This stuff is great even if you haven't got the best aim because it foams and drops them fast. The foam sprays from far away and also is thick. I will never try another wasp spray as this one is the very best.
customer_reviews.author: Ask The Gnome

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Noticed a wasp nest under our house in our storage area that was right near the entrance. Wasn’t sure if the best was active but to be safe I purchased this. My boyfriend sprayed the nest and luckily it was an old one and no wasps were present. It was easy to use and the nest started to deteriorate shortly after. Doesn’t smell too bad either.
customer_reviews.author: Carebear

customer_reviews.title: Foaming good
customer_reviews.text: Fast, easy and effective. I've never seen foaming wasp spray before so I was really surprised. It only took a little bit to cover the nest completely. Literally just a squirt. This is the best wasp spray I have ever used.
customer_reviews.author: Paul A. Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done!
customer_reviews.text: This worked awesome. It killed a wasp nest immediately. However, the 20 ft spay distance, it will reach but not with any sort of coverage. I was still about 10 feet away and was able to easily take out a nest. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Snitker

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff. Killed 3 wasps nest
customer_reviews.text: love how quickly this stuff foams up so nothing can escape and come sting me. I got all bundled up in sweatshirt, hood, goggles, gloves, so that nothing could come get me ... turned out I needed none of it. Just sprayed this stuff over the entire nest and nothing was able to escape. Killed three different small nests within a few minutes and not a single wasp escaped to come get their revenge. good stuff.
customer_reviews.author: B. D.

customer_reviews.title: Worked great
customer_reviews.text: I had a huge wasp nest right above my garage door. This worked great, getting rid of all the wasps in just one try. I'd heard from family that the spray they'd used in the past took nearly the whole can, but I just sprayed for a couple of seconds, and I imagine I still have most of the can left (not that I can actually see inside it!). I probably even used more than I needed to.
customer_reviews.author: rbittman

customer_reviews.title: Works Better Than Expected
customer_reviews.text: I had a nest form under my mailbox...between the box and the wood where it could not be seen...so every time we tried to get our mail a swarm of wasp would come out at us. We could not see the nest to spray but with this it made a thick foam we put all the way around the bottom of the box where it met the wood and it killed the entire nest in one dose. It kills anything going in or out of the nest through the foam. By far the best product for the job I have ever found.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Lodge

customer_reviews.title: Why is “Scent” a review point?!
customer_reviews.text: The range on this is a bit short, however the expanding foam does what it needs to do. I hit 3 nests early in the morning (before the sun was up), and there were no wasps alive when I got home from work at the end of the day. It is really only effective up to 5 feet, so if you are looking to hit high branches, or eves and overhangs on buildings look elsewhere. On another, less important, note; why would Amazon’s automatic review categories include “Scent”? If you are smelling this you used too much or are using it somewhere you shouldn’t be. It is designed to kill things, which it does, admirably.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Incredible results
customer_reviews.text: Had a hornets nest as big as a football on the front porch roof hanging. Not a good place to be. The hornets do a good job eliminating meat bees, but if you get too close oh boy! Used this spray when bees were asleep in the evening following directions. I was a little apprehensive doing it, but it was a cinch to use, and melted that nest. Not one bee came out and I just swept the whole thing away the next day.
customer_reviews.author: Margie

customer_reviews.title: Worth a little extra money!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is amazing. I was concerned about the wasps flying out of the nest and stinging me after spraying them. They had absolutely no chance. This sprays a thick foam that coats the entire hive almost instantly. The wasps had no way to fly out. The foam gently dripped for the next few hours, leaving all of the dead wasps on the ground. Well worth a few extra bucks to get this brand, I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Terri HumphreyBattson

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT reach 20 feet above ground
customer_reviews.text: This specifically advertises that it reaches 20 feet above ground, and it very much does not. It reaches maybe 15' total, and that's including me holding the can above my head. Also, you only get that distance for a few seconds when the can is full; after that, the reach is even less. Does it kill bees? I don't know. The bees are 20 feet above the ground.
customer_reviews.author: J. Scott

customer_reviews.title: Foamy
customer_reviews.text: Used this to take out a hornets nest from 10ft away and I think it had even more reach. The foam completely covered the nest with a 2 second spray. I got out of there after spraying but, I didn’t see any wasps getting out of the foam. Next day I saw a wasp around the nest but, I think the residue got him as I was able to clean it up two day with no bugs in sight. This WORKS!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: It worked: Quick and Complete
customer_reviews.text: Tried other less invasive methods for an in-ground wasp problem that was getting out of hand. The other solutions, like the traps, did absolutely nothing. Caught not one bee. I hit their entrance hole once around 10am, which clearly dropped activity by what seemed to be 90%, then I hit it again a couple hours later for good measure. My bee problem is now not a bee problem. It sprays with a pretty good distance, and accurately. Super impressed. I'll be getting more if any problem like this occurs again.
customer_reviews.author: James T Marszalek

customer_reviews.title: Price gouging!
customer_reviews.text: Item went from $3 to $12 in a matter of months. It's a great product. Not much in the can. Empty after 8 sprays. It was worth the $3, but not worth $12. And WHY was I asked to rate it on "WARMTH"?
customer_reviews.author: theenoid

customer_reviews.title: Ortho Home Defense
customer_reviews.text: Original review not allowed by Amazon due to complaining about service! Good job Amazon, you lost another household as a customer!! Showed up damaged. Had to use duct tape to hold head assembly together. Sprays sideways and large foam all over then down to small stream sprays. I was wearing most of the spray due to the spray head damaged.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Mulcahey

customer_reviews.title: Only good for the first two sprays
customer_reviews.text: This works great! For killing two wasps per can. I would not recommend using this product for killing individual wasps. The reason being, the spray weakens almost right away and becomes too slow and not strong enough to cover the wasp before it can fly away. The first 1 or two sprays get the job done with ease. After that, it simply isn't sufficient. I'm sure it would be good for a nest. Otherwise, get an electric swatter.
customer_reviews.author: Jen corin

customer_reviews.title: This is amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I am very impressed of how this works. I didn't have to get close to the nest and the wasps died almost instantly. The biggest nest I found had roughly 10 wasps. They all died with one spray. I held it down for like five seconds due to the size of the nest. Honestly it probably would've done the job with a quick spray. I love this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica Sepulveda

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Took away one star because this stuff goes everywhere. Had a small nest in the eave and this stuff sprayed an area at least 2' x2'. Since the instructions cautioned against spraying painted surfaces once the hornets were dead I had to drag out the hose and spray down the side of the house. It does the job but be prepared for a mess.
customer_reviews.author: mcavs

customer_reviews.title: Worthless
customer_reviews.text: It's troubling to see so many positive reviews on this product but I'm willing to concede that perhaps I got a can from a bad batch. I tried the spray - the sprayed foam spreads, not the pinpoint jet described in the details. It didn't kill the wasps sprayed, nor did the foam trap the wasps, they just flew away angry. Angry wasps are certainly not what you want when trying to get rid of them.
customer_reviews.author: C. Symmonds

customer_reviews.title: Scared those wasps away
customer_reviews.text: my house is a 2 story so having the ability to shoot this foam that high was really helpful plus the wasps didn't seem to like it ;) They tried to come back to a different area of the house and I used this to make short work of their new development. The original nest had about 30 wasps; between the two applications they were down to about 7 (some simply got away before they were hit). Good stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Lolo

customer_reviews.title: mind the tape
customer_reviews.text: It came with a protective tape over the top. Here's a tip, use scissors to cut it off. I pulled it off and the sprayer, cap and nozzle all fell apart. Stuff seems to work fine though.
customer_reviews.author: Dino F

customer_reviews.title: This stuff is AMAZING!
customer_reviews.text: The moment I sprayed the nest the foam took over and there was no way the yellow jackets were going anywhere. it did the job and still had plenty left so I decided to give the other nest that was about 12 ft away. The can says up to 20 ft so I figured why not, it reached it no problem. Very pleased with this Ortho product and will be giving the other products a try now.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Does not work
customer_reviews.text: Bought 4 cans thinking I would like to have the extra around in the future. Ended up using all 4 on a bee nest in the siding. Did not faze the bees. They almost seemed to like the stuff. Spent the last two days wasting a lot of time using this stuff with no results. 4 cans! I wish I could get my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Rod Mael

customer_reviews.title: Very Effective!
customer_reviews.text: Nothing else I've used ever got rid of those wasps like this product did. Every year I've had to battle ground wasps setting up shop near my garage or front porch. I've been stung a few times by these pests. Finally decided to use this product, which is a foam and hangs around long enough for them to get caught in it trying to get to their nest. It took three applications to kill a couple hundred of them but they never came back.
customer_reviews.author: BlackWolf

customer_reviews.title: A total lack of quality of the product.
customer_reviews.text: This was the most disappointing product I’ve received from Amazon. We buy a lot from Amazon and we have been even more. This product claims to reach up to 20 feet but my can barely made to 12. I have used one can of this to pretty much no benefit. I have a second can which I can return for you to check. I don NOT EVEN care if you give me credit but you should have a look at it, I think. Thank you. But we will still remain loyal customers of Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Btfrompsl

customer_reviews.title: Great wasp nest killer
customer_reviews.text: Used this to get rid of a wasp nest on our umbrella outside from the doorway. It was pretty easy to aim and get it, and effectively got rid of all of the wasps so that I was able to remove the nest
customer_reviews.author: D.C.

customer_reviews.title: Kills Wasps Quickly and Eas
customer_reviews.text: I had two paper wasp nests close to front door. One is the outdoor open light and one in the corner almost next to the roof. Anytime front door would get open, one would fly inside. After my cat got stung, it got personal haha. I ordered one can and sprayed both nests at night. None flew out and all died quickly. We knocked the nest in the morning. I am very happy with the product, how quick and efficient it was. Reached nest high up (2 story house) with no problem. I still have decent amount of product left. ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ from me
customer_reviews.author: Martyna D

customer_reviews.title: Good bye yellow jackets
customer_reviews.text: Found a nest of yellow jackets while mowing my front yard, I got stung (hurt like hell). Used the foam spray at night, and now they are gone. Very easy to use, no tabs to pull, just shake well and you're ready to go. Highly recommend. I'm a little paranoid to mow the grass, afraid I might find another nest.
customer_reviews.author: Prostock7

product_meta.title: Ortho Home Defense Hornet & Wasp Killer7, 16 Oz
product_meta.description: Style:Wasp KillerOrtho Home Defense Hornet & Wasp Killer7 is the one product you need to protect against hornets, wasps, yellow jackets and other listed insects. You no longer have to stand close; the jet spray reaches nests up to 20 feet about the ground! The foaming spray traps wasps and hornets inside the nest, providing rapid knockdown and kill. It also kills the hornets and wasps that return to the nest after it has been sprayed.
feature_bullets: Kills wasps, yellow jackets, mud daubers and hornets
Jet spray reaches nests up to 20 feet above ground allowing you to stand a safe distance from the nest
Kills insects that return to the nest
Pinpoint accurate foam reaches nests under roof eaves, around carports, doorways, window frames and other outdoor areas

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars4,376 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
